tool.name: split sequence file on sample ids
tool.description: Split a single post-split_libraries.py fasta (or post-split_libraries_fastq.py fastq) file into per-sample files.
tool.command:
split_sequence_file_on_sample_ids.py -i $input_seqs_fp -o split_sequence_file_on_sample_ids_output #if $buffer_size: --buffer_size=$buffer_size #end if
#if str($file_type): --file_type=$file_type #end if ; compress_path.py -i split_sequence_file_on_sample_ids_output -o $output_dir

param.label: -i/--input_seqs_fp: the input fasta file to split
param.name: input_seqs_fp

param.label: --buffer_size: the number of sequences to read into memory before writing to file (you usually won't need to change this) [default: 500]
param.name: buffer_size

param.label: --file_type: Type of file. Either fasta or fastq
param.name: file_type

tool.help: Split a single post-split_libraries.py fasta (or post-split_libraries_fastq.py fastq) file into per-sample fasta files. This script requires that the sequences identitifers are in post-split_libraries.py format (i.e., SampleID_SeqID). A file will be created for each unique SampleID. This script will produce an output directory with as many files as samples.
